## Explortatry Analysis
```{r}
read.csv("https://gist.githubusercontent.com/curran/a08a1080b88344b0c8a7/raw/0e7a9b0a5d22642a06d3d5b9bcbad9890c8ee534/iris.csv") -> iris

summary(iris)
library(reshape2)
library(tidyverse)
iris2 <- melt(iris, id.vars =   "species")
iris2 %>% rename(cm = value) -> iris2


ggplot(iris2, aes(x = variable, y = cm, fill = variable)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  facet_wrap(~species) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust=1))
  
  

library(ggplot2)
library(GGally)

        ggpairs(iris,
            columns = c(1:4),
            title="Paired Plots of Iris ", 
            upper = list( combo = "facethist"),
            lower = list(combo =  'dot_no_facet',   alpha=0.2), #regrees
            diag = list(discrete = "barDiag", continuous="densityDiag"),
            mapping=ggplot2::aes(colour = species, fill=species, alpha=0.1))    
```
Take a closer look at sepal length, petal length and petal width.
```{r}
ggplot(data=iris, aes(x=sepal_length, y=petal_length, color=species)) + geom_point(aes(size = petal_width)) + geom_smooth(method="lm")
ggplot(data=iris, aes(x=sepal_length, y=petal_width, color=species)) + geom_point(size=3) + geom_smooth(method="lm")  
ggplot(data=iris, aes(x=petal_length, y=petal_width, color=species)) + geom_point(size=3) + geom_smooth(method="lm")


```
In three dimensions
```{r}


colors <- c("red", "green", "blue")
iris$color <- colors[ as.numeric( as.factor(iris$species) ) ]

# Plot
plot3d( 
  x=iris$petal_length, y=iris$petal_width, z=iris$sepal_length, 
  col = iris$color, 
  type = 's', 
  radius = .1,
  xlab="Sepal Length", ylab="Sepal Width", zlab="Petal Length")
```
